snippet: The authority said it had taken out loans to cover a shortfall caused by Israel’s withholding tax revenue it collects on the Palestinians’ behalf.
abstract: Palestinian Authority pays its employees 60 percent of their salaries for December by taking out loans to cover for shortfall created by Israel's withholding of $127 million in tax revenue.
lead_paragraph: The authority said it had taken out loans to cover a shortfall caused by Israel’s withholding tax revenue it collects on the Palestinians’ behalf.

headline.main: Palestinian Authority Gives Partial Salaries to Employees
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Authority Uses Loans to Pay Employees
